org.phlo.tuplez.operation
Interface Operation<InputType,OutputType>

Type Parameters:
InputType - Interface representing a database operation's input parameters
OutputType - Interface representing a database operation's output parameters
All Superinterfaces:
OperationInput<InputType>, OperationOutput<OutputType>
public interface Operation<InputType,OutputType>
extends OperationInput<InputType>, OperationOutput<OutputType>

Operation is base Interface which must be implemented by all classes representing concrete database operations (i.e. SQL statements).

The SQL statement represented by an Operation can either be supplied by annotating the concrete Operation implementation with Statement, or by implementing the interface StatementIsComputed in addition to Operation.

For each (named) parameter in the SQL statement, the InputType must define a corresponding getter method (following the usual Java Bean naming convention, i.e. the getter for the parameter :myValue has to be called getMyValue()).

Similarly, for each column of the statement's result, the OutputType must contain a getter. The name to column matching is more lenient than in the input case - the getter's name must get<columnName> after both strings have been down-cased and all non-alphanumeric characters have been removed.

The OutputType's getter's return type determined the JDBC ResultSet accessor method used to extract the output value.

The mapping of column names to OutputType getters and to ResultSet accessors can be overriden by annotating concrete database operation classes with OutputMapping.

Operation extends OperationInput and OperationOutput, each parameterized with the InputType respectively the OutputType. This allows other parameterized interfaces like GeneratesKey to force a particular InputType or OutputType.

See Also:
OperationInput, OperationOutput, Statement, OutputMapping
